content:
• Tuesday, April 30, 2013
  • GNW

    More on Genworth Financial (NYSE:GNW) Q1 earnings: The U.S. mortgage insurance unit is...

    More on Genworth Financial (NYSE:GNW) Q1 earnings: The U.S. mortgage insurance unit is profitable by $21M in the quarter after racking up about $2B in losses over the last 5 years, including a $32M loss in Q4, and a $44M loss a year ago. Shares +5.8% AH to $10.61, still less than one-third of $32.90/share of tangible book value. Conference call tomorrow at 9 ET. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • DWA

    More on DreamWorks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA): Q1 beats across the board, masking a 39% Y/Y drop in...

    More on DreamWorks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA): Q1 beats across the board, masking a 39% Y/Y drop in net profit as the computer-animation studio's overhead costs grew and revenue edged lower. Separately, reports are circulating that the company is close to buying AwesomenessTV, a YouTube network aimed at teens and tweens. The network was launched last June after rounding up $3.5M in funding and has nearly 500K subscribers and generated more than 80M video views last month. Shares +6.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 PM
  • HIMX

    Himax (NASDAQ:HIMX) -8.2% AH after filing an F-3 that will allow the company and top customer...

    Himax (NASDAQ:HIMX) -8.2% AH after filing an F-3 that will allow the company and top customer Innolux to respectively sell 25.5M and 25.4M shares (collectively 30% of outstanding shares) in future public offerings; no offering is planned for now. Himax's huge run-up over the last 6 months likely has something to do with the filing. Q1 results arrive on May 7. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 PM | 6 Comments
  • FIRE

    Sourcefire (NASDAQ:FIRE) now +9.8% AH following its Q1 report. Though the IPS security hardware...

    Sourcefire (NASDAQ:FIRE) now +9.8% AH following its Q1 report. Though the IPS security hardware leader missed estimates and issued light Q2 guidance, it reiterated its 2013 revenue growth guidance of 25% on its CC, soothing concerns about U.S. federal orders. Meanwhile, UTM security hardware leader Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) is almost unchanged AH in spite of issuing soft 2013 guidance to go with its Q1 results. Fortinet expects 2013 revenue of $595M-$605M and EPS of $0.49, below a consensus of $611.9M and $0.57 - a downward revision was probably expected following the company's April 10 warning.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) SolarWinds (SWI - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $77.8M-$78.8M and...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) SolarWinds (SWI - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $77.8M-$78.8M and EPS of $0.37-$0.38, below a consensus of $80.7M and $0.39. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $326.5M-$334M and EPS of $1.59-$1.65 vs. a consensus of $336.1M and $1.62. 2) Cavium (CAVM - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of ~$74M and EPS of $0.21-$0.23 vs. a consensus of $74.1M and $0.22. 3) Sonus (SONS - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $66M-$68M and EPS of -$0.01 to $0.00 vs. a consensus of $64.9M and $0.00. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $267M-$271M and EPS of $0.00-$0.01 vs. a consensus of $268.7M and $0.00. SWI -8.4% AH. CAVM +4.1%. SONS +4.8%. (SolarWinds PR) (Cavium PR) (Sonus PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM
  • GPRE

    Green Plains Renewable Energy (NASDAQ:GPRE): Q1 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $765.4M...

    Green Plains Renewable Energy (NASDAQ:GPRE): Q1 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $765.4M beats by $33.88M. Shares +15.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM

    Yamana Gold (NYSE:AUY): Q1 EPS of $0.16 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $534.9M (-4.4% Y/Y) misses...

    RPX (NASDAQ:RPXC): Q1 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $61.2M (+40% Y/Y) beats by $1.08M. Shares +5.3% AH. (PR)

  • Z

    Trulia (TRLA): Q1 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $24M (+97% Y/Y) beats by $2.9M....

    Trulia (TRLA): Q1 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $24M (+97% Y/Y) beats by $2.9M. Adjusted EBITDA of $1.2M, at high end of guidance range. Expects Q2 revenue of $27.3M-$27.7M, above $24.4M consensus. Expects Q2 adjusted EBITDA of $2.5M-$2.9M. Shares +8.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM

    ShoreTel (NASDAQ:SHOR): Q1 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $78.3M. Shares +7.8% AH. (PR)

  • NUAN

    Nuance (NUAN -18.3%) +1.5% AH, recouping a small portion of today's huge post-earnings decline,...

    Nuance (NUAN -18.3%) +1.5% AH, recouping a small portion of today's huge post-earnings decline, after Carl Icahn discloses he has raised his stake in the company to 10.7% from a prior 9.3%. (13G) (Nuance FQ2: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • VRTX

    More on Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX): Q1 beats on both EPS and revenue, but net profit...

    More on Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX): Q1 beats on both EPS and revenue, but net profit swung to a loss on a 25% drop in total sales as fewer patients initiated treatment - leading to a 42% drop in Incivek revenue - and its bottom line was hit by a write down tied to its hepatitis C program. The drug devoeloper has now reported four straight quarters of losses amid slumping sales of Incivek as patients and doctors await new therapies from other drug developers. Shares +1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • MRVL

    Cavium Networks (CAVM): Q1 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $69.5M beats by $0.2M. Shares...

    Brightcove (NASDAQ:BCOV): Q1 EPS of -$0.06 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $24.7M (+24% Y/Y) beats by...

    Brightcove (NASDAQ:BCOV): Q1 EPS of -$0.06 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $24.7M (+24% Y/Y) beats by $0.92M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Flextronics (FLEX - earnings) expects FQ1 revenue of $5.3B-$5.6B and...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Flextronics (FLEX - earnings) expects FQ1 revenue of $5.3B-$5.6B and EPS of $0.12-$0.16 vs. a consensus of $5.45B and $0.16. 2) Sourcefire (FIRE - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $60.5M-$63.5M and EPS of $0.13-$0.16, largely below a consensus of $63.3M and $0.19. 3) Jive Software (JIVE - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $34.5M-$35.5M and EPS of -$0.16 to -$0.18, below a consensus of $36.2M and -$0.14. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $148M-$153M and EPS of -$0.55 to -$0.62 vs. a consensus of $151.9M and -$0.56. FLEX -2.2% AH. FIRE +4.7%. JIVE -0.7%. (Flextronics PR) (Sourcefire PR) (Jive PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment

    MagnaChip Semiconsductor (NYSE:MX): Q1 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $205.3M (+16%...

    MagnaChip Semiconsductor (NYSE:MX): Q1 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $205.3M (+16% Y/Y) beats by $0.16M. Shares +1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • OUTD

    The bidding war continues for Outdoor Channel Holdings (NASDAQ:OUTD) with InterMedia coming back...

    The bidding war continues for Outdoor Channel Holdings (NASDAQ:OUTD) with InterMedia coming back and upping its bid to $9.15 in cash, trumping Kroenke's $8.75 offer. Shares are up 9.4% AH to $9.57 as this may not be the final story. Congrats to SA Pro authors Whopper Investments and Chris DeMuth who played this situation like a Stradivarius, sniffing out that Kroenke's $8.75 offer was designed to be beat.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT): Q1 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.05. Non-GAAP Revenue of $155.8M (+8% Y/Y)...

    Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT): Q1 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.05. Non-GAAP Revenue of $155.8M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $12.39M. Shares +7.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • MSPD

    Mindspeed (NASDAQ:MSPD) +8.3% AH after announcing (in tandem with its FQ2 report) it has hired...

    Mindspeed (NASDAQ:MSPD) +8.3% AH after announcing (in tandem with its FQ2 report) it has hired Morgan Stanley to explore "strategic alternatives." With a market cap that's barely above $100M (after factoring the AH gain), the networking equipment chipmaker would be fairly easy for a bigger rival to digest, should one be interested in doing so. Shares closed near their 52-week low today, nearly a month after getting crushed thanks to a warning. Update (6:01): Shares are now up 31% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • FISV

    Fiserv (NASDAQ:FISV): Q1 EPS of $1.33 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $1.15B misses by $0.05B....

    Fiserv (NASDAQ:FISV): Q1 EPS of $1.33 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $1.15B misses by $0.05B. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • MNK

    More on Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR): Q1 misses badly on all counts, despite a 41% jump in...

    More on Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR): Q1 misses badly on all counts, despite a 41% jump in Y/Y net sales. The company says that the quarter was negatively impacted by several transitional events, including: distribution channel disruptions due to the Medicaid rebate change, the timing of Acthar orders that were received and filled and the introduction of a new reimbursement support center. Additionally, the company experienced a reduction in the number of Acthar prescriptions to treat MS exacerbations. Shares -8.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • SWI

    SolarWinds (NYSE:SWI): Q1 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $72.9M (+22% Y/Y). Shares...

    SolarWinds (NYSE:SWI): Q1 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $72.9M (+22% Y/Y). Shares -8.4% AH. (PR)

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR): Q1 EPS of $0.76 misses by $0.20. Revenue of $135M (+41% Y/Y)...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR): Q1 EPS of $0.76 misses by $0.20. Revenue of $135M (+41% Y/Y) misses by $22M. (PR). Shares -9.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL): Q1 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $5.1M beats by $100K....

    UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL): Q1 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $5.1M beats by $100K. SG&A expenses of $2.2M vs. $900K a year ago, R&D expenses of $1.9M vs. $1.1M a year ago. Cash balance increased by $2.7M Q/Q to $15.7M ahead of stock offering. Shares -2.1% AH. CC at 4:30PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 9 Comments

    Dreamworks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA): Q1 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $134.6M beats by...

    Sourcefire (NASDAQ:FIRE): Q1 EPS of $0.11 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $56.2M (+21% Y/Y) misses...

    NCR (NYSE:NCR): Q1 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $1.41B (+13% Y/Y) beats by $70M....

    NCR (NYSE:NCR): Q1 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $1.41B (+13% Y/Y) beats by $70M. Expects 2013 constant currency revenue growth of 9%-11% vs. 10.1% consensus for actual dollar growth. Expects 2013 EPS of $2.70-$2.80, largely favorable to $2.71 consensus. Shares +2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • SLCA

    Today's plunge in U.S. Silica (SLCA -3.3%) following Q1 earnings is slowed after Morgan Stanley...

    Today's plunge in U.S. Silica (SLCA -3.3%) following Q1 earnings is slowed after Morgan Stanley upgrades shares to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $25 price target; the firm cites valuation, favorable fundamentals and the announcement of a regular dividend. Shares had slumped as much as 14.5% in morning trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA -3.7%) slides after reporting a wider than expected Q1 loss this...

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA -3.7%) slides after reporting a wider than expected Q1 loss this morning. The company attributes the miss to the January 2012 launch of a competitor's generic Lovenox, causing decreased unit sales and lower market share, which in turn led to lower prices in response to competitor pricing reductions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • SPN

    Superior Energy (SPN +3%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $34 price target, up from $28,...

    Superior Energy (SPN +3%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $34 price target, up from $28, at Sterne Agee after posting solid Q1 results bolstered by a focus on costs. The firm believes earnings have bottomed, expects strong free cash in 2013-15, likes management focus on deleveraging and returning cash to shareholders, and sees shares attractively valued.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • CRIS

    Curis (CRIS -8.6%) gets slammed after reporting a Q1 EPS loss that was worse than expected. Per...

    Curis (CRIS -8.6%) gets slammed after reporting a Q1 EPS loss that was worse than expected. Per share earnings were halved from what they were during the same quarter last year, largely due to higher interest expenses and Q112 being skewed by $10M in license fee revenues received from Genentech upon FDA approval of Erivedge.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial (HIG +3.2%) surges to an new 52-week high post earnings, with JPMorgan's...

    Hartford Financial (HIG +3.2%) surges to an new 52-week high post earnings, with JPMorgan's Jimmy Bhullar noting particularly strong margins in both commercial and consumer P&C lines, and suggesting an acceleration of share buybacks as a catalyst to even more upside.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum's (MPC -5.4%) Q1 earnings jumped 22%, in line with expectations, and revenues...

    Marathon Petroleum's (MPC -5.4%) Q1 earnings jumped 22%, in line with expectations, and revenues beat forecasts, as its new Galveston Bay refinery bought from BP in February added to sales volumes. But the market is focusing on a weaker-than-expected refining margin and higher-than-expected cash operating costs, sending shares sharply lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining (NEM -6.5%) shares tumble to 2008 lows as mining costs keep leaking higher, even...

    Newmont Mining (NEM -6.5%) shares tumble to 2008 lows as mining costs keep leaking higher, even after costs surged 40% between 2010 and last year. Also, Q1 profits fell 36% and gold production slipped 11%. Jefferies cuts its target price to $32 from $40, perhaps the first of several downgrades and/or price-target cuts in store for NEM.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 5 Comments
  • INFA

    Informatica (INFA -3%), Splunk (SPLK -1.9%), and Qlik (QLIK -3%), 3 names hyped as analytics/big...

    Informatica (INFA -3%), Splunk (SPLK -1.9%), and Qlik (QLIK -3%), 3 names hyped as analytics/big data plays, slump in response to Microstrategy's (MSTR -11.1%) big Q1 miss, which includes a 24% Y/Y drop in produce license revenue. As is its custom, the business intelligence software vendor gives no reason for its miss, nor does it provide guidance or an earnings call. It is, however, happy to note its buyback program ($455M remaining) has been extended to April 2018. Microstrategy's numbers are overshadowing solid results from rival Actuate (BIRT +6.2%); the company posted 16% Y/Y Q1 license rev. growth, compared with nearly flat total rev. growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • BVN

    Q1 results spelled out a worst-case scenario for Compañia de Mina Buenaventura (BVN...

    Q1 results spelled out a worst-case scenario for Compaia de Mina Buenaventura (BVN -6.9%): earnings came up short, production fell, and costs didn’t drop nearly enough. Credit Suisse cuts BVN to Neutral from Outperform, finding “no positives in sight" for shares other than rising gold prices - and even that wouldn’t provide as much of a boost as its peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • XYL

    Xylem (XYL -2.5%) blames a Q1 top line miss on "European economic challenges, U.S. industry...

    Xylem (XYL -2.5%) blames a Q1 top line miss on "European economic challenges, U.S. industry weakness, and lower shipments for treatment products." Revenues were down in both of the company's business segments as Water Infrastructure and Applied Water sales slid 6% and 3% Y/Y respectively. XYL, which reiterated its FY13 EPS guidance of $1.79-1.89 per share, says it is working to become more competitive and efficient. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • RPTP

    The FDA approves Raptor Pharmaceuticals' (RPTP +11%) Procysbi, a delayed-release version of...

    The FDA approves Raptor Pharmaceuticals' (RPTP +11%) Procysbi, a delayed-release version of Mylan's (MYL -0.1%) Cystagon. The drugs treat nephropathic cystinosis. RPTP could see revenues of $77M in 2015 from the drug, Bloomberg says.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell (MXWL +4.4%) rallies after providing "unaudited financial highlights" for Q4 2012 and Q1...

    Maxwell (MXWL +4.4%) rallies after providing "unaudited financial highlights" for Q4 2012 and Q1 2013, as it continues to work on restating past results. The company's invoiced shipments for Q4 and Q1 respectively totaled $41.9M and $46.6M, above a revenue consensus of $39.2M and $38.3M, with ultracapacitor shipments totaling $26.1M and $33.1M. Maxwell's cash balance was $34.1M at the end of Q1, and its debt obligations $9.1M. The company adds it will increase contract assembly capacity for large-cell ultracapacitors by ~50% in Q3 to meet rising demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +8.2%) is now up strongly in the wake of its Q1 report (I, II), and is giving a...

    3D Systems (DDD +8.2%) is now up strongly in the wake of its Q1 report (I, II), and is giving a lift to rivals Stratasys (SSYS +5.4%) and ExOne (XONE +2.8%). On 3D's earnings call, CFO Damon Gregoire (previous) insisted a rising materials margin and a greater mix of materials revenue can allow total gross margin to rise further. Piper (Ovreweight) notes organic growth was 22% (total rev. growth was 31%), while predicting the industry "can sustain 20%+ growth over the next several years." U.S. sales +25% Y/Y, Europe +38%, Asia-Pac +45%. Stratasys reports on May 13.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 4 Comments
  • OIS

    Oil States International (OIS +16.3%) shares hit all-time highs after Jana Partners disclosed a...

    Oil States International (OIS +16.3%) shares hit all-time highs after Jana Partners disclosed a 9.1% stake in the company and said it’s talked with management about separating OIS's well-site services unit and creating a REIT for the oilfield housing business. The accomodations unit may be valued as much as $5.5B under a REIT structure, Sterne Agee estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • TTHI

    Midday top 10 gainers: TTHI +45%. PTIE +26%. DRRX +26%. MTOR +23%. MGAM +20%. OIS +16%. GIB...

    Midday top 10 gainers: TTHI +45%. PTIE +26%. DRRX +26%. MTOR +23%. MGAM +20%. OIS +16%. GIB +14%. HGSH +15%. ARWR +13%. TXRH +13%.
    Midday top 10 losers: OTC:DCTH -44%. AVEO -26%. NUAN -18%. AOSL -18%. PBI -16%. AEIS -13%. MSTR -10%. ANV -10%. ELTK -10%. SYN -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • AMX

    America Movil (AMX +2.6%) rallies after filing its 2012 20-F. The giant Latin American carrier...

    America Movil (AMX +2.6%) rallies after filing its 2012 20-F. The giant Latin American carrier admits Mexico's telecom reform bill could have a material impact on its results starting in 2014, but this is already widely expected.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • TX

    Latin American steelmaker Ternium (TX +5.1%) surges higher after saying it won’t pursue a...

    Latin American steelmaker Ternium (TX +5.1%) surges higher after saying it won’t pursue a purchase of ThyseenKrupp's (OTCPK:TYEKF) steel plant in Rio de Janeiro state in Brazil because of its valuation and industry conditions in Brazil. TX says it is assessing alternative growth options after backing out of the bidding process. (Q1 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • AGCO

    AGCO trades 4.8% higher after its earnings beat on both the top and bottom line. Revenue grew...

    AGCO trades 4.8% higher after its earnings beat on both the top and bottom line. Revenue grew 26%, 31%, and 10% in South America, Asia/Pacific, and North America respectively and the company said it exceeded its Q1 operating margin targets as well. Farm economics are "attractive," CEO Martin Richenhagen says, noting that strong farm income in 2012 is driving high levels of "industry demand in North America." In addition to outstripping analyst estimates, the company raised its FY13 EPS outlook to $5.50-5.70 from previous guidance of $5.10-5.35. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (SFLY +1.7%) acquires MyPublisher, a provider of online photo book publishing...

    Shutterfly (SFLY +1.7%) acquires MyPublisher, a provider of online photo book publishing services based on proprietary software, for an undisclosed sum. Shutterfly touts the natural synergies between MyPublisher's offerings and its own online photo product platform. News of the deal come ahead of Shutterfly's Q1 report, due tomorrow afternoon.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA (MBI -5.8%) investors are disappointed at not winning summary judgement in the case against...

    MBIA (MBI -5.8%) investors are disappointed at not winning summary judgement in the case against Bank of America, but the ruling as a whole sends "a very strong message to BAC about how difficult it would be for it to win at trial," writes Mark Palmer. He still expects BofA to cut a deal either out of self-interest or after being forced to the table by regulators. MKM Partners agrees and maintains its Buy rating and $18 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 2 Comments
  • AUXL

    Shares of Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL +3.5%) appear to have leveled out after yesterday's...

    Shares of Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL +3.5%) appear to have leveled out after yesterday's earnings-related drubbing, inching higher this morning after Stifel Nicolas upgraded the shares to Buy with a $19 price tag on the weakness.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM

    Anadigics (ANAD +10.2%) skies higher following its Q1 report. The results were nothing special, but expectations were low, and the Street seems encouraged by the momentum for Anadigics' nascent Wi-Fi front-end chip (FEIC) business. Wi-Fi sales rose to $4.8M in Q1 from $1.1M in Q4, and Anadigics mentioned on its earnings call its FEICs are found in several prominent Wi-Fi chipset reference designs. That, in turn, has led to major smartphone/tablet design wins, including for Samsung's Galaxy S4. Q1 gross margin was just 1%, down from Q4's 2.5%. Opex +9% Y/Y vs. rev. growth of -7%.
